title: Why are my "Use USB For" Settings Disabled?
content:
I've worked with 2 different Google Store Support reps, and all steps have failed. On my Pixel 3, we have tried resetting the phone, changing the developer default USB use for settings, new USB A to USB C cables, Installing a Windows MediaFeaturePack-OOB-Package on my PC, All to no avail. If anyone can help, please reply.

Addition to this post a day later:

After working with Google Support, I tried one suggestion of theirs...

Dust off the female USB-C connection port on the phone...

How does one do that I thought?... Duh!, use a can of compressed Gas/air made for dusting off electronics... I put the little red extension tube on the can, pointed at the USB-C port, and gave it a few quick busts of air... Then I tried to connect the USC-A to USB-C cable to My PC and the phones's port, and instantly the phone recognized the PC and un-greyed or enabled the "USB use for" settings allowing me to change the setting to "file transfer".

I must say a big Thank You to Google Support technicians for their patience and assistance with this issue... I hope this post is useful for everyone with the same issue i have seen posted in the support forum...
